Spells.spellDescription: Draw a small amount of energy over time.
Spells.spellLore: Since its discovery by John Dee, this Hex has proven tried and true and perfectly safe for modern witches.

Spells.spellDescription: Instantly burn energy from the target.
Spells.spellLore: Refined by witches over time, this spell was an accidental discovery of Helvetius in his pursuit to transmute lead into gold.

Spells.spellDescription: Prevent your target from taking flight.
Spells.spellLore: Most assign this simple and dependable variation of the binding spell to Aradia herself, as it was first used by the Italian Benandanti under her guidance in the Ember Wars.

Spells.spellDescription: Not today, Death.
Spells.spellLore: Why mess with perfection? We owe the Voodoo Sisters for this brand of resurrection. Crafted by the bayou queen Marie Laveau in the mid nineteenth-century.

Spells.spellDescription: Bless a target, providing energy and protection.
Spells.spellLore: This particular spell adopts the poorly kept secrets of Abremelin the Mage concerning the transmutation of the sun's power into magical energy.

Spells.spellDescription: Bind the tongue of your target.
Spells.spellLore: Little magic can be used without the spoken word. This version of silence is a secret stolen from the dark Cimmerian Shades that are so adept at silencing trespassers upon their shore.

Spells.spellDescription: A piercing light that steals energy from the target.
Spells.spellLore: Shared willingly by the Rosicrucian mystics, this lance of light is believed to be cast from the heart of divine man.

Spells.spellDescription: Revive a target bound by death's grasp.
Spells.spellLore: Said to be written on the walls of the Atlantean Mystery Temple, this powerful spell of restoration has little changed over the centuries.

Spells.spellDescription: Drop a target's power and resilience at once.
Spells.spellLore: This remarkably complicated seal was discovered by a not so remarkable herbalist and pharmacologist living in Detroit. He gifted the seal to the Grey Hand coven in 1958 signing it simply as Mr. Davidson.

Spells.spellDescription: A trade-off for the common good.
Spells.spellLore: Inflict harm to your target, but fear not. Healing will come within time. Some of the greatest things require the biggest sacrifices.

Spells.spellDescription: Cleanse a target of a single random afflicted condition.
Spells.spellLore: The Egyptian Book of the Dead is a trove of wisdom for knowing witches. The dead must be cleansed to traverse the Underworld. This spell is informed by those secret Egyptian rituals.

Spells.spellDescription: Reduce the effect of incoming spells.
Spells.spellLore: Set a target's power equal to its alignment. Assigned to many authors from a Master Mason to an scribe in the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn to an earthen vessel found among the ruins of Solomon's Temple.

Spells.spellDescription: Swap power and resilience.
Spells.spellLore: The secret of this balancing spell was hidden for years behind an alchemical cryptogram until it was found deciphered among the papers of John Wilkins, a seventeenth century Bishop of Chester and alleged agent of the Sons of Enoch.

Spells.spellDescription: Set a target's power equal to its alignment.
Spells.spellLore: Assigned to many authors from a Master Mason to a scribe within the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn to an earthen vessel found among the ruins of Solomon's Temple. Either way, works like a charm.

Spells.spellDescription: Set a target's resilience opposite to its alignment.
Spells.spellLore: Discovered first among the mutilated Hermetic fragments, this spell was once cast by the Singers of ancient Eqypt in their musical spellcraft. It has been carefully altered by the Grey Hand coven for modern witches.

Spells.spellDescription: Reflect half damage taken back at the opposing caster.
Spells.spellLore: The philosopher mages of the Alexandrian School of Neo-Platonism came under many magical attacks. Hypatia herself crafted this defensive spell to protect her disciples.

Spells.spellDescription: Become stronger when attacked with shadow spells.
Spells.spellLore: Comte di Cagliostro suffered dearly for all his magical genius. He left this spell upon the wall of the Inquisitional dungeon in San Leo. The effect, he claimed, strengthened him against his tormentors.

Spells.spellDescription: Cast Seal on your target three times.
Spells.spellLore: Threefold the power of your common Seal.

Spells.spellDescription: Cast Bless on your target three times.
Spells.spellLore: Threefold the power of your common Bless.

Spells.spellDescription: Cast Hex on your target three times.
Spells.spellLore: Threefold the power of your common Hex.

Spells.spellDescription: Cleanse all of your target's afflictions.
Spells.spellLore: This is the full measure of your power to Dispel.

Spells.spellDescription: Begone, witch!
Spells.spellLore: Instantly cast your target to some remote region of the world. A favorite Signature of the gamesome witches of the Seven Hills coven. Designed as a spell of teleportation, this unintentional version was found in an esoteric volume stolen from the library of John Dee.

Spells.spellDescription: Bind a witch and leave them susceptible to attack.
Spells.spellLore: This Signature spell was found somewhere in the esoteric doctrine of the Druids. Masters of all binding magic, the target feels as if they are bound with briars, the pain dulling their wits.

Spells.spellDescription: Receive energy over a period of time, but take major damage afterward
Spells.spellLore: The notorious psychopomp known as the Prince of Merchants sold this Signature to human witches when our war with vampires was at it's most violent. Like most dealings with the Prince, the price is always steep for immediate gains.

Spells.spellDescription: Directly absorb the energy of an opposing target
Spells.spellLore: It is recited by the Sons of Enoch that the Chaldeans held dominion over Babylon, albeit briefly, on the strength of their vampire houses. These houses were known to practice powerful blood magic. While this Signature requires no blood, it's psychic properties are just as strong as the Chaldean variety.

Spells.spellDescription: Confuses the target, randomizing the spells they cast
Spells.spellLore: A favorite of the Hermetic orders, nothing delights a trickster witch like addling the mind of their target. Pythagoris stumbled upon this Signature in his study of symmetrical geometric solids. It has remained unchanged in the Grey Hand grimoire.

Spells.spellDescription: Drastically lower a target's chances for a successful cast
Spells.spellLore: The wonder mirrors of Japan served as little more than curiosities until one was discovered to reveal a secret pattern that informed the Signature of this powerful spell.

Spells.spellDescription: Dedicate yourself to love and compassion.
Spells.spellLore: Raise a target from the dead, and shield them with an aura of protection.

Spells.spellDescription: Merely defeating Death is the work of amateurs.
Spells.spellLore: Bring a target from the binds of Death and grant them firm Resilience for several minutes. However, target will also take damage over time.

Spells.spellDescription: Scream like the Wendigo.
Spells.spellLore: Jack Fiddler, the notorious witch that made his name banishing Wendigos, was taught the secret of stealing their unearthly screams by a mysterious Cree medicine girl only known as Kanti. It is from her wisdom that we craft this Signature.

WitchSchool.description: Of course you can fly! Let's learn flight and the important difference between Spirit and Physical form.
WitchSchool.title: Flight school for witches.

WitchSchool.description: How to summon Otherworldly spirits and the rule that must not be broken.
WitchSchool.title: The unstable art of Summoning.

WitchSchool.description: How to deal with our illustrious gypsy-sage Madame Fortuna, trader of all things witchy.
WitchSchool.title: Madame Fortuna's emporium.

WitchSchool.description: How to enjoy the hundreds of cosmetic variations a witch can have.
WitchSchool.title: Managing your wardrobe.

WitchSchool.description: Collecting and keeping track of your botanicals, tools, gems and unique items.
WitchSchool.title: Managing your inventory.

WitchSchool.description: Every day is different in Covens. Let's learn how the moon effects your magical energy.
WitchSchool.title: How the moon influences your energy.

WitchSchool.description: Let's take a tour of the main user interface of Covens.
WitchSchool.title: Understanding the user interface.

WitchSchool.description: Witchcraft is not simple sorcery! Here we learn the old ways of wielding magic and how to make the most of ingredients.
WitchSchool.title: Making the most of your spells.

WitchSchool.description: Let's learn how your spell choices influence your alignment. And how your alignment effects the spells you cast.
WitchSchool.title: Learning the alignment paths: Shadow, White and Grey.

FTFDialogues.value: Savannah Grey: "You’re all alone, witch. Let’s get you some protection."
Savannah Grey: “The Barghest is a spectral hound that can act as a protector for witches.”
Savannah Grey: "Before you can summon the Barghest, you must first defeat it in battle."
Savannah Grey: "Tap on the Barghest Spirit to continue."
Savannah Grey: "I will weaken this Barghest for you."
Savannah Grey: "Let's use a spell from the White School to capture this Barghest."
Savannah Grey: "Well done! You have captured your first spirit."
Savannah Grey: "The Barghest is now in your Spirit Deck."
Savannah Grey: "There are hundreds of spirits in the world that can be captured and summoned."
Savannah Grey: "Let's summon the Barghest now..."
Savannah Grey: "Brilliant! You completed your first summoning ritual!"
Savannah Grey: The Barghest is a Familiar type spirit. It will follow you around and protect you."
Savannah Grey: "It will be very aggressive to anything that attacks you, especially other witches . . ."
Savannah Grey: "Speaking of other witches, I’ve summoned Ms. Brigid Sawyer to {{Location}} to offer a little guidance . . ."
Brigid Sawyer / Seven Hills Coven / Dominion of California
Savannah Grey: “Ms. Sawyer, so good to see you. I see you've chosen the Shadow Path . . .”
Brigid Sawyer: “I find comfort in the shadows, Dea.”
Savannah Grey: “Now, tap Brigid's icon on the map.”
Savannah Grey: “Let’s begin by casting a simple Hex on Brigid . . ."
Savannah Grey: “Your common Hex did a little damage to Brigid. It will do more damage over time unless it is dispelled."
Savannah Grey: "Brigid is immune to your magic until she casts on you."
Brigid Sawyer: “What an adorable little Hex, {{Player Name}}. You’ve saved me the trouble of feeding Theo, my Fowler spirit.”
Savannah Grey: "Bringing your Fowler to train a new witch, Brigid? Seems out of taste."
Brigid Sawyer: "I thought you'd be impressed, Dea."
Savannah Grey: "How can we teach {{him/her}} witchcraft when {{he/she}} cannot speak?!"
Brigid Sawyer: "I think a Cat Sidhe’s got {{his/her}} tongue, Dea."
Savannah Grey: "Let's give this cheeky witch something that—"
Brigid uses signature ingredients to cast: Mirrors.
Savannah Grey: "You are one bold little witch, Brigid Sawyer."
Savannah Grey: "No bother, {{Player Name}}, I'm granting you a very powerful blessing called Truesight."
Savannah Grey: "The gift of Truesight allows you to see what is not meant to be seen."
Savannah Grey: "{{Player Name}}! Brigid has lost the plot! You have my word she'll pay for that... Let's get you back on your feet!"
Savannah Grey: "Brigid used ingredients to make her spell more powerful, including the very rare Halfeti rose only found in Turkey."
Savannah Grey: "I will grant you a blessing of Energy every day. Use my gift wisely."
Brigid Sawyer: "Really, Dea? Banish me to Uluru!? {{Player Name}}, I'll send you a bill for my services . . ."
Savannah Grey: "I think it's time we introduce you to Madame Fortuna. She can provide you sufficient ingredients to get started . . ."
Madame Fortuna: "Sastipe, Dea Grey! It is always a pleasure my dear lady . . ."
Savannah Grey: "The pleasure is mine, dear friend. {{Player Name}} is our newest witch; {{he/she}} needs a collection of ingredients for {{his/her}} spellcraft."
Madame Fortuna: "Va! Sastipe, {{Player Name}}, you have come to the right place. And I have just the collection for a witch learning their craft . . ."
Savannah Grey: "Abondia's Best collection added 210 items to your inventory! You can collect items for spellcraft all over the world."
Savannah Grey: "Well, witch, that's quite enough hand-holding. I officially welcome you to the {{Season}} tournament of witchcraft. {{Number}} days remain."
Savannah Grey: "This is just the beginning of your adventure. I strongly suggest you visit Witch School, but if you're the adventurous type, feel free to explore on your own."
Savannah Grey: "As long as you abide my rules, I'll continue to grant you a daily blessing of Energy."

Gardens.title: Grove of the Bell Witch
Gardens.description: Here is the chosen ground of the legendary barrow sister known as the Bell Witch. This old sister has made too many bargains with agents of the Underworld to be trusted. While this area will provide in plenty, we do not recommend you stay for long. There is little warning when the Bell Witch will rise from her grotto.

Gardens.title: Brocken Mountain
Gardens.description: A favorite haunt for witches since ancient times. It is here that a coven of Pythagorean disciples perfected the earliest forms of astral projection. We know them now as the first Greek shamans. Before their final soul-journey, they consecrated the Brocken as a bastion for all future magic workers. It served as a chosen staging ground for witches during the Ember Wars.

Gardens.title: Times Square
Gardens.description: Beneath the concrete and neon of this urban jungle magical energies converge to form one of the major crossroads of the modern world. Such convergence creates a wellspring of spiritual and magical powers and quickens the heart's blood of every witch that gathers here.

Gardens.title: The Ancient Crossroad
Gardens.description: Modern-day Kabul is built on the crossroads of the ancient world. The veil has long been thin in this realm allowing Otherworldly spirits easy passage into our world. If we trust the Sons of Enoch, it is here that around 1608 the great Italian covens gathered to form the hive "Good Walkers" and banished the evil Duke Murmur back to the Underworld.

Gardens.title: Nakagusuku Grove
Gardens.description: Toil and trouble abound in this realm. The Sons of Enoch claim this grove was home to a clan of figurine-carvers that with imperial patronage studied the art of necromancy in the hope to animate fallen ancestors of the royal family. They proved to be master carvers, but their mediation with the dead only served to corrupt the land of Nakagusuku.

Gardens.title: Mingshan Mountain
Gardens.description: The King of Hell may have left the door open, for the Mingshan Mountain is trafficked by spirits as well as demonkind. Witches should not dwell too long in this city of ghosts. Should you choose to harvest here, do so by day.

Gardens.title: Hell-Fire Club
Gardens.description: The Brass Castle, on top of Montpelier Hill was made with the stones of nearby ancient graves. This caused the spirits to lash out and grow restless in the surrounding area. The hill is home to the paranormal and where members of the occult come to gather.

Gardens.title: Hacienda Castilla
Gardens.description: The desert wind soughs through the ruins of old La Noria, whispering the names of the many who have died here. This is a quiet land; a land of sadness; a land of ghosts. A knowing witch may find counsel with the languishing spirits of La Noria, and wisdom in such counsel, but beware the demons that feed upon their sadness.

Gardens.title: Xunantunich Temple
Gardens.description: Xunantunich means “Stone Woman” in Mayan and it is named after the haunting figure in white that roams the grounds here. Her presence draws many more spirits to the Castillo.

Gardens.title: Hoghton Tower
Gardens.description: Hoghton Tower is a fortified manor house located about two-thirds of a mile to the east of the village of Hoghton, Lancashire, England, and standing on a hilltop site on the highest point in the area.

Gardens.title: Grove of Aricia
Gardens.description: Diana Nemorensis, also known as "Diana of the Wood", was an Italic form of the goddess who became Hellenised during the fourth century BCE and conflated with Artemis. Her sanctuary was to be found on the northern shore of Lake Nemi beneath the cliffs of the modern city Nemi.

Gardens.title: Mount Hekla
Gardens.description: Mount Hekla is located in the highly active volcanic zone along the south shore and is the most active volcano in Iceland with more than 20 eruptions since 874. The volcano is part of a volcanic ridge, 25 miles long.

Collectibles.name: Black Candle
Collectibles.description: A candle dark as the midnight sky.

Collectibles.name: Black Crystal
Collectibles.description: A black crystal.

Collectibles.name: Bloody Cloth
Collectibles.description: A rag soaked in thick crimson blood.

Collectibles.name: Bloody Hat
Collectibles.description: An old, dusty hat stained in hearts blood.

Collectibles.name: Blue Candle
Collectibles.description: A candle as blue as the sea.

Collectibles.name: Blue Lantern
Collectibles.description: An old lantern with a deep blue glow.

Collectibles.name: Bottle of Sake
Collectibles.description: A bottle of Japanese rice wine.

Collectibles.name: Broken Needle
Collectibles.description: This thin, sharp sewing tool is no longer useful.

Collectibles.name: Cake Batter
Collectibles.description: A creamy dough used for baking.

Collectibles.name: Carved Benitier
Collectibles.description: An antique, hand-carved basin for holy water.

Collectibles.name: Cingulum
Collectibles.description: A traditional nine-foot long cord used for spellcraft.

Collectibles.name: Cocoa Beans
Collectibles.description: Roasted Cocoa Beans.

Collectibles.name: Coolie Sun Hat
Collectibles.description: Conical sun hat primarily worn in Asian countries.

Collectibles.name: Copper Nugget
Collectibles.description: A lump of copper.

Collectibles.name: Crimson Shard
Collectibles.description: A red shard broken from a forgotten monolith.

Collectibles.name: Crocodile Tooth
Collectibles.description: A fetid tooth from one of nature's greatest beasts.

Collectibles.name: Crystal Prism
Collectibles.description: A clear prism that can reflect light to create a rainbow.

Collectibles.name: Cusha Jar
Collectibles.description: A glass jar that once contained Guatemalan liquor.

Collectibles.name: Dreamcatcher
Collectibles.description: Web woven strands of cord within a willow hoop.

Collectibles.name: Eagle Feather
Collectibles.description: Flight feather of an eagle.

Collectibles.name: Earrings
Collectibles.description: Earrings cut to capture light from all angles.

Collectibles.name: Edamame
Collectibles.description: Edamame soybeans boiled to tasteful perfection.

Collectibles.name: Ema Board
Collectibles.description: Small wooden prayer or wishing plaque.

Collectibles.name: Fine Sand
Collectibles.description: A pouch of smooth, pure sand.

Collectibles.name: Fire Iron
Collectibles.description: Used for stoking a fire.

Collectibles.name: Fish Oil
Collectibles.description: Oils derived from the tissues of fish.

Collectibles.name: Flint Knife
Collectibles.description: Hard dark colored knife that can be used to create fire.

Collectibles.name: Floral Wreath
Collectibles.description: A wreath finely decorated with an assortment of flowers.

Collectibles.name: Fried Tofu Bags
Collectibles.description: A pouch made from tofu.

Collectibles.name: Gohei Wand
Collectibles.description: Decorated wooden wands used in Shinto.

Collectibles.name: Golden Frog Leg
Collectibles.description: A leg taken from the carcass of a Panamanian golden frog.

Collectibles.name: Guilder
Collectibles.description: The currency of Suriname.

Collectibles.name: Handkerchiefs
Collectibles.description: Three sets of three pocket sized rags.

Collectibles.name: Hare Fur
Collectibles.description: Fur from a rabbit.

Collectibles.name: Hatian Gourde
Collectibles.description: The currency of Haiti.

Collectibles.name: Headdress
Collectibles.description: A feathered Native American war bonnet.

Collectibles.name: Honey Dipper
Collectibles.description: Used to collect honey from jars.

Collectibles.name: Jar of Honey
Collectibles.description: A glass jar filled to the top with sweet, sticky honey.

Collectibles.name: Hourglass
Collectibles.description: A tool with glass bulbs where passing sand is used to tell time.

Collectibles.name: Icosahedron
Collectibles.description: A figure with twenty normally equilateral triangle planes.

Collectibles.name: Iron Collar
Collectibles.description: Collar made from iron used for punishment.

Collectibles.name: Iron Lock
Collectibles.description: A lock made from iron.

Collectibles.name: Janice Mirror
Collectibles.description: A mirror that may or may not lead to other dimensions.

Collectibles.name: Joker Card
Collectibles.description: One of the four Joker cards in a traditional card deck.

Collectibles.name: Kaskara Blade
Collectibles.description: The blade of an ancient kaskara sword.

Collectibles.name: Kurikara Blade
Collectibles.description: A blade of a kurikara sword said to kill demons.

Collectibles.name: Lava Lamp
Collectibles.description: A groovy wax mixture inside of a glass vessel.

Collectibles.name: Leather Bridle
Collectibles.description: A leather strap used to steer a horse.

Collectibles.name: Loamy Soil
Collectibles.description: Soil consisting of sand, silt, and clay.

Collectibles.name: Lump of Coal
Collectibles.description: A sedimentary rock typically found underground, or in stockings.

Collectibles.name: Machete
Collectibles.description: A machete sharper than the blade of a razor.

Collectibles.name: Mayan Ink
Collectibles.description: Ink used to ritualistically tattoo ancient Mayans.

Collectibles.name: Metronome
Collectibles.description: Can be used for musical or hypnotic purposes.

Collectibles.name: Milk Bottle
Collectibles.description: This glass jar once held plain white milk.

Collectibles.name: Mortar & Pestle
Collectibles.description: Used to crush and grind ingredients.

Collectibles.name: Murky Water
Collectibles.description: Vial of muddy water taken from a pond.

Collectibles.name: Oily Feather
Collectibles.description: A feather slathered in thick, greasy oil.

Collectibles.name: Old Ale Tankard
Collectibles.description: Old steel drinking cup once used in taverns, inns, and pubs.

Collectibles.name: Old Broom
Collectibles.description: A common household item used for sweeping, not flying.

Collectibles.name: Old Scroll
Collectibles.description: Ancient text rolled up in a crusty sheet of paper.

Collectibles.name: Onyx Amulet
Collectibles.description: Amulet with an onyx gem in the center.

Collectibles.name: Onyx Circlet
Collectibles.description: Circlet with an onyx gem in the center.

Collectibles.name: Onyx Ring
Collectibles.description: Ring with an onyx gem in the center.

Collectibles.name: Ox Horn
Collectibles.description: The horn of an ox.

Collectibles.name: Pedang
Collectibles.description: The Malaysian word for "sword".

Collectibles.name: Petrified Wood
Collectibles.description: A slab of fossilized remains of wood.

Collectibles.name: Pile of Bones
Collectibles.description: Weathered animal bones from an unknown time.

Collectibles.name: Raw Meat
Collectibles.description: A slab of bloody, raw meat from an unknown source.

Collectibles.name: Red Candle
Collectibles.description: A candle red as blood.

Collectibles.name: Red Diamond
Collectibles.description: A diamond with a blood red tint.

Collectibles.name: Red Pine Ashes
Collectibles.description: Ashes from a burned down red pine tree.

Collectibles.name: Red Ribbon
Collectibles.description: A silky ribbon in eye-popping red.

Collectibles.name: Red Wine
Collectibles.description: A glass of red wine from the Greek Agiorgitiko variety.

Collectibles.name: Rocks Glass
Collectibles.description: A glass normally used for hard liquor.

Collectibles.name: Rotten Egg
Collectibles.description: Eating this smelly, old egg is not a wise decision.

Collectibles.name: Rusty Flask
Collectibles.description: An old steel flask that holds half liquid, half rust.

Collectibles.name: Salamander Tail
Collectibles.description: A salamander's tail. Don't worry, it grew back.

Collectibles.name: Scented Candle
Collectibles.description: A candle with a luxurious scent.

Collectibles.name: Serpent Venom
Collectibles.description: The venom extracted from a deadly serpent.

Collectibles.name: Seven Bells
Collectibles.description: Seven silver ritual bells.

Collectibles.name: Shark's Tooth
Collectibles.description: One of many teeth found in the mouths of the ocean's kings.

Collectibles.name: Silver Amulet
Collectibles.description: Amulet made from carefully shined silver.

Collectibles.name: Silver Comb
Collectibles.description: Only the prepared should keep this in their possession.

Collectibles.name: Silver Harness
Collectibles.description: A harness of silver made to submit the greatests of beasts.

Collectibles.name: Small Meteorite
Collectibles.description: A piece of debris that fell from a comet or meteor.

Collectibles.name: Snake Oil
Collectibles.description: Oil from extracted Chinese snake fat used in medicinal practice.

Collectibles.name: Spearhead
Collectibles.description: Sharp end of a native Atlatl throwing spear.

Collectibles.name: Stone Trinket
Collectibles.description: An ornament handcarved from stone.

Collectibles.name: Tamalera
Collectibles.description: Aluminum steamer used for making tamales.

Collectibles.name: Tapir's Trunk
Collectibles.description: A trunk removed from a deceased pig-like tapir.

Collectibles.name: Terracotta
Collectibles.description: An ornament handmade from clay-based terracotta.

Collectibles.name: Toad's Heart
Collectibles.description: Yeah, it's a dried toad's heart.

Collectibles.name: Tobacco Pipe
Collectibles.description: Hollow device used to smoke tobacco.

Collectibles.name: Trapelacucha
Collectibles.description: Linked, silver plated ornament worn by Mapuche women.

Collectibles.name: Tribal Mask
Collectibles.description: A piece broken off of an ancient, colorful ceremonial mask.

Collectibles.name: Vial of Blood
Collectibles.description: Vial of thick, red blood from an unknown source.

Collectibles.name: Votive Candle
Collectibles.description: White candle used often in offerings.

Collectibles.name: White Candle
Collectibles.description: A candle white as the moon.

Collectibles.name: White Crystal
Collectibles.description: A white crystal.

Collectibles.name: White Fur
Collectibles.description: A lock of fur as white as snow.

Collectibles.name: Wind Chime
Collectibles.description: Wind chime in the shape of the moon and stars.

Collectibles.name: Wine Spirit
Collectibles.description: A spirit beverage produced by distilled wine.

Collectibles.name: Witchetty Grub
Collectibles.description: Large, white, larvae of Australian moths.

Collectibles.name: Wolverine Tooth
Collectibles.description: A fang sharp enough to cut diamonds.

Collectibles.name: Wooden Doll
Collectibles.description: Chunks of wood arranged to form a human figurine.

Collectibles.name: Xtabentún
Collectibles.description: A Yucatán liqueur made from anise seed.

Collectibles.name: Yellow Candle
Collectibles.description: A candle colored as the sun.

Collectibles.name: Adder's Fork
Collectibles.description: A fern with fangs and a favorite piece for the cauldron of wayward sisters.

Collectibles.name: Agathosma
Collectibles.description: The oil of Agathosma was over harvested in the coven wars of Africa in the 1980's. Rare now, but just as potent, especially in baneful magics.

Collectibles.name: Agrimony
Collectibles.description: A lovely flower known to induce even more lovely dreams. Used wisely a hex breaker, aura cleanser and general aid to healing spells.

Collectibles.name: Ague Weed
Collectibles.description: Favored by trickster witches of the grey path, useful in deception and brain addling spells.

Collectibles.name: Allspice
Collectibles.description: The favorite botanical of the Obi Man of Jamaica, it is associated with Mars, fire and masculine energy. Typically empowers a spell no matter the alignment.

Collectibles.name: Althea
Collectibles.description: Once found by the sacred pools of Avalon, it served as a powerful botanical in the time of Arthur. Now more common with witches the potency of the flower seems to have waned.

Collectibles.name: Ambergris
Collectibles.description: Remove this

Collectibles.name: Angelica
Collectibles.description: Aligned with sun and flames and the angelic world, used in the Ember Wars to keep evil plague bringers in check.

Collectibles.name: Anise
Collectibles.description: Ruled by Mercury, a kitchen herb, used in protection from evil spirits by those brave or foolish enough to harness them, and often carried in a satchet to ward off the evil eye.

Collectibles.name: Antarctic Hair Grass
Collectibles.description: The world's most southernmost plant. Can be found in frozen lands, and is one of the only two signs of life in Antarctica

Collectibles.name: Antarctic Pearl Wort
Collectibles.description: This small, yellow flower can be found in the world's frozen lands. It is, along with its Antarctic Hair Grass sister, one of the only two signs of life in Antarctica.

Collectibles.name: Asafetida
Collectibles.description: For the wise, this herb can cast out devils or ease the passage of good spirits entering our world.

Collectibles.name: Ayahuasca
Collectibles.description: Powerful portal to oneness, healing, and self-knowledge if guided by a shaman pure of heart. Violent illness is often experienced prior to vision.

Collectibles.name: Balm of Gilead
Collectibles.description: Balm of Gilead was a rare perfume often used medicinally, and often thought of as a cure all. It is named for the region of Gilead which can be found in the Bible.

Collectibles.name: Barberry
Collectibles.description: It is not unlike the barberry to bewilder a witch that does not know its proper use. Take care in your craft with this seeming innocuous sweet; or eat it and be done with it.

Collectibles.name: Basil
Collectibles.description: A practical botanical especially useful in benevolent and protective spellcraft.

Collectibles.name: Bay Leaf
Collectibles.description: Exceptionally useful as a fumigant, worn by healers, and those in need of luck.  Powerful oracles are said to gain clarity of vision through burning the bay leaf.

Collectibles.name: Belladonna
Collectibles.description: Nature's embodiment of the beautiful lady of war. In the hands of an adept it can empower the strongest spells in witchcraft, but to the novice it can be deadly.

Collectibles.name: Bergamot
Collectibles.description: An herb of the sun, but versatile. Adept shadow witches have learned creative ways to use Bergamot. The wisest barrow sisters are said to use bergamot to induce long sleeps allowing them to traverse the Otherworld.

Collectibles.name: Betony
Collectibles.description: A humble leaf for clear thinking. Little risk means little gains. A suitable border for graveyards.

Collectibles.name: Bindweed
Collectibles.description: Herb of gladness, clever use will grant you courage. The witches that faced the White Jikininki on Mount Koya are said to have burned a ring of bindweed before the battle.

Collectibles.name: Birch
Collectibles.description: White lady of the woods, her innate powers are myriad. All alignments may find potent uses for Birch. They have sheltered the wood witches for centuries and served the venerable Benandanti in their astral wanderings.

Collectibles.name: Black Nightshade
Collectibles.description: A rare and potent plant, sacred to the enchanter. The black nightshade should never be harvested in the light of day. A component to many powerful signatures, its use should be reserved to well practiced witches.

Collectibles.name: Blueberry
Collectibles.description: A tasty rich berry for protection. While not making delicious foods out of it, keeping it near your home will protect you from evil spirits, magic, and wrongdoings.

Collectibles.name: Borage
Collectibles.description: Borage was often eaten by Roman soldiers before battle and worn in scarves by Medieval Knights. Known as the happy herb and used to dispel many negative effects.

Collectibles.name: Broom Top
Collectibles.description: Decorative branches adorned with yellow flowers brought together in a clutch, carried by maidens to promote peace after the Ember Days. Lightly fragrant incense burned within the bundle creates a superior wanding effect.

Collectibles.name: Calamus Root
Collectibles.description: Cherished as a fragrant anointing oil to calm warriors before battle, and a staple of love potions.

Collectibles.name: Camphor
Collectibles.description: A gift of the evergreen tree, symbol of life amongst death, this fragrant white compound possesses many spiritual properties.  Witches of both alignments would do well to offer this substance to the creator during the new moon.

Collectibles.name: Capsicum
Collectibles.description: An enhancement to any potion or spell crafted by fire, and/or dealing with the fiery emotions associated with heartache, or passions driven by anger. Strong protective properties.

Collectibles.name: Caraway Seed
Collectibles.description: If utilized with a honest heart, this seed safeguards property against theft as well as protects those in love from the wondering eye of lust.

Collectibles.name: Cedar
Collectibles.description: Cedar is primarily used for protection of a person and sacred places and may aid in the summoning of helpful spirits.

Collectibles.name: Chamomile
Collectibles.description: Chamomile is associated with the sun, Leo and the element of water. It is used in spells for money, peace, love, tranquility and purification.

Collectibles.name: Clove
Collectibles.description: Soothing to the troubled digestive system and a preferable treatment over that of the black slime. A princely spice for those of exaggerated, and over used canine teeth.

Collectibles.name: Cock's Comb
Collectibles.description: Otherwise the Amaranth, sacred to the Aztecs. A crown may be made for the head to improve healing, the dried leaves may ease communication with the dead. German witches claim the red variety aids in spells of deception.

Collectibles.name: Datura
Collectibles.description: Many Datura species have white flowers and only bloom at night giving them a strong relationship with the moon. It is used primarily to hex and remove hexes. It is also known to induce sleep and dreams of the future.

Collectibles.name: Dead Sea Salt
Collectibles.description: Uses include cleansing crystals, grounding, protection magic and ritual. Used on the altar to represent the Earth. Used with water for blessing, consecration and casting circles.

Collectibles.name: Deadly Nightshade
Collectibles.description: All witches are drawn to the deadly belladonna, but far too many believe they possess the wisdom to harness its beautiful power. The wrong signature is death, but the right may make your name among the old sisters.

Collectibles.name: Deer's Tongue
Collectibles.description: Resembling a tongue, this plant grants a witch easy eloquence, allowing clear pronunciation of difficult spells.

Collectibles.name: Devil's Bit
Collectibles.description: The short root so angered practitioners of plague that its rosette head is frequently bitten off by the devil, angry at the plant's ability to cure flesh meant to fester.

Collectibles.name: Dogbane
Collectibles.description: Dogbane is known as the brave plant that enjoys casting shadows, often used to make hidden spirits visible.

Collectibles.name: Dragon's Blood
Collectibles.description: Colored like dried blood, and carried most practically in resin form so that it might be burned, dissolved in liquid, or sprinkled about the practitioner for a multitude of powerful purposes.

Collectibles.name: Elder
Collectibles.description: Berries of both sustenance and poison, a portal tree establishing passage between the world of the Fay and the Mortal.  The gravediggers and hearse coachman’s talisman against hauntings.

Collectibles.name: Eucalyptus
Collectibles.description: Bound to the water and moon. Spell craft favors the plant infused with candles of blue and green only if set within a ring.

Collectibles.name: Eye Bright
Collectibles.description: Eyebright is associated with the element of air, the sun, and Leo and with the Tower Tarot card. Used in spells to help avoid or remove deception and to make spirits seen.

Collectibles.name: Eye of Newt
Collectibles.description: The pungent mustard seed is a miniscule agent of confusion. Used improperly it can addle the mind of the practitioner, but used well it can be helpful to a cunning witch.

Collectibles.name: Fennel
Collectibles.description: The Sons of Enoch mention fennel as a favorite herb of John Dee in summoning a more passive spirit. Queer results are known, but use of fennel may sharpen the tongue and memory.

Collectibles.name: Five Finger Grass
Collectibles.description: Shaped roughly as a hand, this grass is foundational to many a Hoodoo curse, and also appreciated by those who delve into the interpretation of dreams. Aids the memory, inspires confidence.

Collectibles.name: Foxglove
Collectibles.description: Useful to destroy the living, and to raise the dead.  Collect the fallen damps from its petals will allow a practitioner to more easily commune with the Fay as well as the easing of a broken heart. Carefully burned during séance it increases contact with the dead, perhaps by killing the participants.

Collectibles.name: Frangipani
Collectibles.description: A favorite of the young, attracts love, trust, and admiration while promoting openness by those around.

Collectibles.name: Frankincense
Collectibles.description: Trust the Orphic Hymns or not, the burning of frankincense is likely to please your patron. The smoke of frankincense purifies the air, consider burning in a censer for clarity of thought.

Collectibles.name: Galangal
Collectibles.description: Staple of tribunal ceremony and commonly reserved for the wise among us. Nurtures the fires within, aids in focus.

Collectibles.name: Garlic
Collectibles.description: It is said Roman soldiers ate garlic before battle for strength and bravery and it was used in various ways during the plague, as well as to ward off evil spirits, protection from vampires, the evil eye and protection from hexes.

Collectibles.name: Geranium
Collectibles.description: A tea infused with wild Geranium flowers might provide an effective counter to spells of romance. A bit of the root can be carried as an amulet to attract happiness and prosperity though it should be replaced every third day. It can also be used in spells to encourage sympathy.

Collectibles.name: Ghost Orchid
Collectibles.description: The embodiment of the forest wives, lovely spirits that are always friends to witches. Draw this flower carefully beneath a dark moon to maximize its potency.

Collectibles.name: Hawthorn
Collectibles.description: Hawthorn is a sacred tree in many Pagan religions. Used to prevent people and spirits from entering a sacred place. May be used in many protection spells.

Collectibles.name: Hazel
Collectibles.description: One of the nine traditional woods burned in the Balefire by the Druids at Beltaine, burned for wisdom. Known in ancient times as the “Tree of Wisdom”. Used for a myriad of spells including controlling spirits, hexing, protection, and divination.

Collectibles.name: Heather
Collectibles.description: Heather can be used to change the appearance, and improve beauty. May be used in protection spells and to summon friendly spirits and against violent spirits.

Collectibles.name: Heliotrope
Collectibles.description: For those afflicted by unrequited love, experiencing the presence of this plant as it follows the sun mollifies the humors often giving rise to gaiety. One should take heed, however, that too much time in such a place can cause emotional invisibility.

Collectibles.name: Hellebore
Collectibles.description: Lovely flowers that might push through the snow if planted where tears have once fallen.  An ancient cure for madness, though more poisonous than most lunacy.

Collectibles.name: Hemlock
Collectibles.description: Though characteristically used in the anointing of weaponry, its obscure but most powerful use is in the anointment of a talisman gifted to someone closed that you wish to open to debate.  Or, just use it as a poison.

Collectibles.name: Henbane
Collectibles.description: Henbane is crucial in times of drought leading into the battle for the harvest.  Toss into water with prayers and supplication to bring the rain.  Be watchful for Banshee attending the spell driven weather. Useful to flavor ales. Induces delirium.

Collectibles.name: Honeysuckle
Collectibles.description: Soften your spellcraft with honeysuckle. Known to induce amorous dreams, this sweet blossom may not empower your works, but may seduce your subject, albeit briefly.

Collectibles.name: Hyacinth
Collectibles.description: Promotes peace of mind and peaceful sleep. Attracts love, luck, and good fortune. Best used when the rainbow adorns the sky. Guards against nightmares when used as an oil, burned as incense, or dusted upon the pillow. Carry in an amulet or sachet to ease grief or the pain of childbirth.

Collectibles.name: Hyssop
Collectibles.description: Hyssop is the fragrant herb often used to freshen homes, particularly the kitchen. It is used for spells of healing and protection and to counter hexes.

Collectibles.name: Jasmine
Collectibles.description: The most widely used purification herb in all worship. Lightens vibrations and promotes spiritual opening.

Collectibles.name: Juniper
Collectibles.description: In rare signatures, could induce prophetic visions; explore its use against wasting afflictions. Never to be used in magic against vampires.

Collectibles.name: Juniper Berry
Collectibles.description: Juniper berries have been found in multiple Egyptian tombs, though the plant is not a known native.The berries may be used for healing and to both give and restore strength and stamina.

Collectibles.name: Jurema
Collectibles.description: The dried bark of certain Jurema trees may be utilized in enlightenment ceremonies in Latin America.

Collectibles.name: Lavender
Collectibles.description: Insipid and innocuous, but sweetens your magic well enough. Some benefit beyond the perfume is lesser known, but there is little harm in trying.

Collectibles.name: Lemon Verbena
Collectibles.description: Lemon Verbena, thought of as the breakup herb, is used to hex and cause strife between allies.

Collectibles.name: Lemongrass
Collectibles.description: In folklore lemongrass is said to repel dragons and serpents. Lemongrass is often used for cleansing and repelling evil, healing, protection, and mind controlling spells.

Collectibles.name: Licorice
Collectibles.description: Licorice root was often buried with the dead to help the soul pass to the other side. Also known as the passion root. Used to expel negative energy and protect from hexes. Licorice is one of the Nine Sacred Herbs of protection.

Collectibles.name: Lilac
Collectibles.description: Lilac is known for its lovely but sometimes obnoxious scent. Used to mask the scent of the dead and for various warding spells. Lilac is also used for the banishment of negative energies.

Collectibles.name: Lily of the Valley
Collectibles.description: Lily of the Valley is often cherished for its symbolism.The herb of peace, tranquility, and purity. Lily of the Valley works well with other healing herbs to bolster their healing power, and may be used to heal and protect.

Collectibles.name: Lobelia
Collectibles.description: One of the herbs of Neptune. Often used in hexing and when combined with other herbs the effects can be particularly powerful and often unpredictable.

Collectibles.name: Lotus
Collectibles.description: Lotus is the flower of the moon and venus leaving the mark of tranquility. It is most often used in spells of protection.

Collectibles.name: Mandrake
Collectibles.description: Taken from black soil, a nightmare; from poor soil, more suitable for your designs. Read the shape closely to consider innate inclinations and harvest at dusk for more potency.

Collectibles.name: Mangrove
Collectibles.description: Mangrove are said to represent a doorway to the Otherworld. Mangrove may be used for spells of protection and possibly to aid in the summoning of spirits. It's also a splendid aid for other similar herbs.

Collectibles.name: Marigold
Collectibles.description: Promotes both grieving and visions when properly applied.  Border your garden to keep unwanted pests from your crafting supplies.

Collectibles.name: Mimosa
Collectibles.description: Mimosa is said to have many qualities including purification, love, and sight into the Otherworld. Mimosa is best used in protection and in the aid of other protection spells.

Collectibles.name: Mistletoe
Collectibles.description: Carrying a sprig on your person will ensure good luck, protection and fertility. Hanging it in the home protects against disease, lightening, werewolves, and having your children switched with faerie changelings. Warring coven leaders will often present mistletoe to one another during periods of truce.

Collectibles.name: Moly
Collectibles.description: In the story the Odyssey, it was this herb that Hermes gave to Odysseus to protect him from Circe's sorcery. Moly is used in spells of protection and to aid other herbs in a similar way.

Collectibles.name: Motherwort
Collectibles.description: Motherwort was first used by the Greeks to soothe the worry of pregnant women and in other cultures to relieve pain. Most often used in healing, but known to counter spells and to protect.

Collectibles.name: Mugwort
Collectibles.description: It's possible Mugwort got it's name from flavoring beverages, the same beverages one would drink from a mug. Mugwort is most commonly thought to aid in both protection and healing spells.

Collectibles.name: Mullein
Collectibles.description: Otherwise the Hag’s Taper, it’s golden bloom serves as a lantern in the darkness of the Otherworld. The soft leaves were burned in the censers of powerful witches as they fought the Mallochio in the Ember Wars. It belongs to the golden hour after dawn. Its rich dye is used to color the robes of the mysterious Rose Handed Coven.

Collectibles.name: Myrica
Collectibles.description: REMOVE

Collectibles.name: Nettle
Collectibles.description: Hippocrates recorded 61 medicinal uses of the nettle in the fourth and fifth centuries. The nettle has been used to drive out unwanted spirits and negative energy and to break hexes.

Collectibles.name: Oakmoss
Collectibles.description: Once used for packing embalmed mummies, today there are few high-classed perfumes without oakmoss oil. Used mostly for protection spells, it may also have some use in healing when applied with other spells.

Collectibles.name: Orris Root
Collectibles.description: Orris Root is considered one of the plants of the moon and most often associated with dreamwork and divination.

Collectibles.name: Paris Nightshade
Collectibles.description: Favored ingredient for the shape shifter as its effects are gentle rather than bone crackingly violent, particularly good for shifting to the wild boar.

Collectibles.name: Parsley
Collectibles.description: Parsley has been associated with Death, and should be used to decorate tombs as well as dinner plates. Never grow it indoors, unless you want death invited into the house.  Wearing it on your head protects from inebriation. Only pregnant women and witches grow parsley properly and know that it should be planted on Good Friday for the best crop. Mistreatment of parsley brings bad luck.

Collectibles.name: Patchouli
Collectibles.description: Strong aromatic used in spells, sachets, baths and mixtures for money and love. Put in the wallet or purse to attract money. Place in a charm or use in incense for fertility. Helps to ground you and bring your consciousness back to the physical level.

Collectibles.name: Pennyroyal
Collectibles.description: Place in your shoes to keep you from tiring when walking long distances, or from motion sickness upon the seas. Good for spells removing the evil eye.  Place on a candle prior to difficult meetings.

Collectibles.name: Pine
Collectibles.description: Promotes new beginnings, clean breaks, prosperity, success, strength, grounding, and growth; Also used for cleansing, purification, and repelling negativity. Good idea to use when seeking to change alignments.

Collectibles.name: Poppy
Collectibles.description: Poppy promotes fertility, prosperity, love and abundance.

Collectibles.name: Queen of the Meadow
Collectibles.description: A leaf tucked into your cheek may ensure that words spoken to the opposite sex will be well-received. Gamblers carry the plant to bring them good luck. Carrying the plant with you will also encourage others to look upon you with respect.

Collectibles.name: Red Alder
Collectibles.description: Draws its strength from water, turns water to blood. Chewed by the witches of old Germany as they celebrated Saturnalia on The Brocken. Not to be trifled with, may induce a crossing of the hedge.

Collectibles.name: Rose Geranium
Collectibles.description: Averts negativity.  Slip a potion to a gossip to end false accusations.

Collectibles.name: Rosemary
Collectibles.description: Clear mindedness and sharpened intellect can be found in the properties of Rosemary, especially when the scent is carried upon the ocean breeze.

Collectibles.name: Rowan
Collectibles.description: A life giver, perfect for wands and divining rods.  Poltergeists particularly avoid Rowan handlers, though Rowan properties invite psychic powers.

Collectibles.name: Rue
Collectibles.description: A cleansing herb used in sprinkling holy water, purported to be one of the ingredients in the Thieves Vinegar used to battle the plague.  A bitter for ceremonial drink.

Collectibles.name: Saint John's Wort
Collectibles.description: St. John's Wort has been used for healing for thousands of years and takes its name from St. John the Baptist. The bloody red color seems more appropriate for the use of expelling particularly evil spirits.

Collectibles.name: San Pedro
Collectibles.description: This cactus has been a primary staple of the Peruvian Shaman for thousands of years.  Commonly used to diagnose and cure illness.

Collectibles.name: Sandalwood
Collectibles.description: The oil extracted by steam distillation from this sacred wood is wonderfully rare and used for protection, exorcism, and healing wounds. Careful to minimize its use near All Saints Eve as the undead embalmed by the oil may seek answers to their restless wanderings.

Collectibles.name: Sassafras
Collectibles.description: This aromatic tree is part of the laurel family, as versatile as any botanical, it has served to provide distinctive flavor to drinks and as a cure-all for Native Americans. While less potent for witchcraft, it should add a little something extra to your magic.

Collectibles.name: Slippery Elm
Collectibles.description: Tall, slim and stately, this tree’s inner bark can be used in a multitude of healing rites, spells, and potions.  It is the bane of jealous slander as this plant effectively shuts the mouth of a gossip.

Collectibles.name: Snakeroot
Collectibles.description: Also called the Black Cohosh, this root was well used in the Ember Wars to empower protective wards. Often used in thresholds to prevent the passing of evil spirits, but some prefer to burn it as the smoke is considered a bane to evil.

Collectibles.name: Solomon's Seal
Collectibles.description: Incense. Keeps sacred oaths & promises forever binding. Keep on altar to promote success in all rituals. Sprinkle an infusion of the root to drive away evil.

Collectibles.name: Spicebush
Collectibles.description: Also the Fever Bush, once used by the Native Americans to cure a litany of ailments, the wood witches and barrow sisters have learned clever uses for Spicebush.

Collectibles.name: Thyme
Collectibles.description: Thyme can be used in spells to increase strength, courage and an indominable spirit.  A paste rubbed upon your shoulders will lighten your melancholy, hopelessness and other negative vibrations.  Known to attract fairies to your garden.

Collectibles.name: Toe of Frog
Collectibles.description: This darling buttercup belies its unlovely name. Common, it's use in witchcraft may be more for style than substance. Or simply to pay homage to those weird sisters.

Collectibles.name: Tongue of Dog
Collectibles.description: Poisonous and harmful to cows and pastures. Used long ago in old Europe to cure sore throats, coughs, and mouth sores. The wayward sisters find a love for this piece.

Collectibles.name: Tormentil
Collectibles.description: The old witches of Appalachia called it bloodroot. Tormentil was used to burn away negative energies, and it's root served as substitute for blood in working their signatures.

Collectibles.name: Vervain
Collectibles.description: A favorite of the Baba Yaga and other wood witches, it's healing powers may be as strong as any herb. It is a powerful supplement to many signatures and used frequently as a bane to vampires. It's effectiveness here is debated among witches.

Collectibles.name: Vetivert
Collectibles.description: A common ground plant with an effective root for simple magic. It serves as a mild calming agent to witches, keeping them in balance and inviting restorative sleep.

Collectibles.name: Willow
Collectibles.description: The willow is considered a sacred wishing tree whose northward facing branches hold the sway of the new moon, the southward branches that the full moon, the eastward waning gibbous, and the westward  waxing gibbous. Tell a willow your wish under the correct conditions and it will come true. Choose the wrong branches and the opposite may likely occur.

Collectibles.name: Witch Egg
Collectibles.description: This rare variety of pungent fungus must be taken in it's earliest egg-sack stage to be useful. If you can suffer the odor, this toadstool can fortify powerful spells.

Collectibles.name: Wolf Claw
Collectibles.description: Used frequently and in a multitude of ways by the Celtic druids, it was woven into robes and bound in protective amulets. To honor the druids only harvest with your left and bare of foot.

Collectibles.name: Wolfsbane
Collectibles.description: The loveliness of this mountain flower is deceptive, it is very toxic. To a practiced witch, it can be used to prevent lycanthropes and other shape-shifters from changing form, but it also serves many spells that hope to inflict harm.

Collectibles.name: Wool of Bat
Collectibles.description: Once used to invoke magnificent results, the modern witches have found less use for holly. It does bring some peace and cheer to the witch, and perhaps it's old powers have hidden some undiscovered signature.

Collectibles.name: Blood Agate
Collectibles.description: Infused with the blood of vampire-kind.

Collectibles.name: Brimstone
Collectibles.description: Burning with the lightless fires of the Underworld.

Collectibles.name: Demon's Eye
Collectibles.description: Rich for rarity. Do not look too long upon this stone.

Collectibles.name: Malachite
Collectibles.description: The travelers stone. No two are alike.

Collectibles.name: Mother's Tear
Collectibles.description: The tear of the moon. The fair mother of dreams.
